tech_news.title: Highguard boss says the player count “doesn’t matter” - Dexerto
tech_news.description: Highguard game director Chad Grenier insists it “doesn’t matter” about the player count, as long as fans love the game.

tech_news.title: Nintendo Switch is the second-bestselling game console ever, behind only the PS2 - Ars Technica
tech_news.description: Switch 2 has already beaten the Wii U and is on its way to overtaking GameCube.

tech_news.title: Secret Lair: Roll for Initiative Superdrop - Magic: The Gathering
tech_news.description: Magic fans from Baldur's Gate, Ravenloft, and beyond—rally your party for the Roll for Initiative Superdrop on February 9, 2026!

tech_news.title: Google court filings suggest ChromeOS has an expiration date - Ars Technica
tech_news.description: ChromeOS may be canned once the current support guarantee has run its course.

tech_news.title: Xcode 26.3 unlocks the power of agentic coding - Apple
tech_news.description: Xcode 26.3 introduces support for agentic coding, a new way in Xcode for developers to build apps, powered by coding agents from Anthropic and OpenAI.

tech_news.title: Grounded 2 thrived whilst Avowed and The Outer Worlds 2 under-performed, so now Obsidian may target shorter development cycles - Eurogamer
tech_news.description: Key Obsidian Entertainment figures have talked to Bloomberg about Avowed, The Outer Worlds 2, and Grounded 2's performance and what might be next.

tech_news.title: Fitbit founders launch AI platform to help families monitor their health - TechCrunch
tech_news.description: Luffu uses AI in the background to gather and organize family information, learn day-to-day patterns, and flag notable changes so families can stay aligned and address potential well-being issues.
